name: Kepler-49
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-49 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-49 is a star with 0.45999999999999985 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.56 times its radius. It is located 1024.20 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-49 is known to have 4 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-49 d

Kepler-49 d was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.03 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 2.58 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-49.

The mass of Kepler-49 d is 2.99 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-49 d is 1.6 that of Earth. At 2.99 Earth masses, Kepler-49 d is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

Kepler-49 e

Kepler-49 e was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.12 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 18.60 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-49.

The mass of Kepler-49 e is 2.79 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-49 e is 1.56 that of Earth. At 2.79 Earth masses, Kepler-49 e is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-49, which contains 4 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
